intro: Cytisus nigricans var. mediterraneus, commonly known as the Mediterranean broom, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, wiry stems that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow, pea-like flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
